title: Murder-suicide on Cleveland's West Side leaves 3 dead, 1 seriously injured, police say
content:
CLEVELAND, Ohio -- Police say three people are dead after an apparent murder-suicide Sunday night at a home on the city's West Side.
A fourth person, a 68-year-old woman, was wounded in the head in the shooting, police said.
The shooting occurred at about 9:15 p.m. Sunday behind a home at 16209 Laverne Ave., just east of West 168th Street.
Police have not yet determined a motive, but the suspected gunman, a 29-year-old male, had a relationship with a 24-year-old woman who was in the home, identified by the Cuyahoga County Medical Examiner's Office as Brittany Reid.
Reid was in the residence with her grandparents, police said.
"It appears to be a boyfriend-girlfriend type of dispute," said Ed Tomba, deputy police chief.
Tomba said the incident began as the grandmother confronted the 29-year-old when she found him in the backyard. The man, armed with a handgun, fired at the woman, grazing her head.
The woman was able to get to a neighbor's house to seek help, but the man entered the home and found Reid and her grandfather, Robert Clarke, 66, upstairs, shooting and killing both.
He then took his own life, Tomba said.
The grandmother was taken to MetroHealth Medical Center in serious condition, but she was conscious and speaking with detectives, Tomba said.
Tomba said police do not suspect anyone else was involved with the shooting. The police department's Homicide Unit, Crime Scene Unit and the Medical Examiner's Office are investigating.
Note: The age of the grandmother has been corrected per new information provided by the police
